item.title: Parsing a PDF containing text is easy with Python...I had a time when I was thinking that way.
item.description: #Foreword Parsing a PDF containing text is easy with Python… If text information is included, you can extract text and table information from the PDF and use that data to easily create a web service. The result of easy thinking is as follows. I will. ** I tried to use PDF data of online medical treatment based on the spread of new coronavirus infection ** https://qiita.com/mima_ita/items/c0f28323f330c5f59ed8 The most important finding I got here is that “** “Stop reading PDF data on a computer and read it by humans.

item.title: I tried to imitate Python Ã— Kivy de Kinoppy (Kinokuniya bookstore application)
item.description: This article is the 14th day of [Personal Development Advent Calendar 2019](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/private-development). And Qiita’s first post. Begin. I am creating a Windows app using a framework called Python x Kivy. ###background I cooked a paper book and made it into PDF. Refreshing! -Now read on your iPad -My child took an iPad… -I bought a Surface! Let’s read on Surface -Unlike iPad, there is no good app for Windows -Kinoppy (Kinokuniya bookstore app) Good!
